result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott K Birk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Menard's, Walmart or Tobacco Store.

from Department of Health and Human Services filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott K Birk in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.   Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 9 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $253.00 (Includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Menards, Walmart or Tobacco Store.  Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate 
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 20 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing July 30, 2015 by 6:00 p.m..  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  LAST 5 DAYS STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.
Joint Witness List Filed by Attorney Bloch.
Hearing on July 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Scott K Birk in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State and Defense are jointly requesting an adjournment. State will be charging a new referral for the defendant. Court will set another date in 30 days. This case may be resolved on the next date. If case is not resolved Defense to advise how this case and the defendant's other case will proceed.  Miranda goodchild motion to be filed by 07/29/2015.  Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
